subject: Charge Up the Paddles, the Jets Are Playing
event:
Why must the Jets stop my heart beating every time they play a game?

Their season almost ended today with a horrendous loss to the Buffalo Bills.  Then the football gods and Buffalo coach Dick Jauron give us an early Christmas present.  Only seconds from the two minute warning, the Bills had the lead and the ball on a second-and-five.  All they had to do was run out the clock and make the Jets burn their timeouts, and the game was over.  The Jets had been unable to stop Bills RB Marshawn Lynch all day.  So what does Buffalo do?  They call a rollout play-action pass.  Then comes a sack and a fumble, Jets recover, Sean Ellis runs it in for a TD and a miraculous victory.  I am tempted to say the Jets snatched victory from the jaws of defeat, but really, it was the Bills who snatched defeat from the jaws of victory.  Bad play by Losman, worse call by the Bills coaches.  

It was the second huge freak play that turned the game.  Back in the first quarter, the Jets were dominating.  Up 14-3 and driving past midfield for a third score.  Then a Favre pass bounces off the hands of Coles, off a Bills defender, off Coles' foot, and into the hands of a second Bills defender.  And suddenly all the momentum shifts.  Very shortly thereafter, the Bills score and are right back in the game.  It's amazing how fast a football game can shift, but that's why I love the sport.

I still don't feel good about the Jets' chances.  They won, but they did not play well, and that season ending game against Miami looms large on the schedule.  The whole situation smells as if it's set up for a Hollywood ending, called "Chad's Revenge."  And right now Pennington and the Fish are playing much better football than Brett and the Jets.

The Giants came is tonight.  Let's see how they do against the quarrelin' Cowboys.

comments.article:
They actually featured the Jets game here on one of the sports channels in Sweden, so I watched most of it. Quite a close call there.

I am not sure about the Dolphins, to be honest. They've underperformed and squeaked by too often. But ... well, I've gotta root for 'em.

OTOH, I've no problem cheering on the Giants against the Cowboys. Good luck to them! I'll have to wait until the morning to read about the results.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: howler monkey
comments.article: My gods, they won that game? We had to leave the house, and it was just when the Bills went up 27-24 and I was sure the Jets were history... Wow.

starting to text to one of George's BiLs (we do this a lot during Jets games) a message from George:

"Game over, season over." when Ellis rumbled over the goal line.

Naturally, the BiL got a cheerier message.

What a game. All I want for the playoffs is a home heart-shock thingy with paddles like on ER. I'll install it next to George's chair.
comments.subject: I was

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: howler monkey
comments.article: You know, I bet I could call one of those in to the mag. I'll FedEx it to you. ;-)
comments.subject: Re: I was

comments.article: An Automated External Defibrillator (AED)? Haha, put it on a wishlist on amazon.com so someone can get it for you... George is a national treasure!!
comments.subject: Re: I was

comments.article: We've been calling the Dolphins the "Cardiac Kids" this season. Pennington has renewed my football spirit tenfold. Can't wait for the Jets game!

Something to calm your nerves a bit: the Giants just gave Corey Webster a contract extension at 5 years/$43.5 mil.  Great move by the Giants.  Webster has developed into one of the top corners in the league.
Webster Accidentally Stabs Self with Machete, Charged with Possession of Concealed Stupidity. Will Share Cell with Plaxico.
comments.subject: Tomorrows Headline

comments.article: Let me guess ...a Cowboys fan.
comments.subject: Re: Tomorrows Headline

comments.article: I've learned the hard way that anytime I start to pay attention to the Jets, they lose.  So the only way I can enjoy being a Jets fan is by not watching them.

I call it Karma. If you sell your soul for a wide receiver you get the Real T.O. Unfortunately I grew up not far from Romo and like seeing him perform well, yet as a Packer fan I have to enjoy watching the Cowboys fall apart. Speaking of conundrums, I like Aaron Rodgers but want to see Favre do well because I love the guy and I want higher draft picks, yet I also like Chad Pennington and support his redemption, and also whenever Brett's Jets win I have to hear everyone complain about Rodgers. *sigh* What a season.
Karma for life!

Defense, defense and yes .... defense wins championships, Georgie Boy. :P

The Ravens proved it in 2000 and unfortunately for the Ravens, they helped us pave the way towards this year.

The only team to hold the Giants "3 headed monster" in check was the black and gold. We now control our own destiny concerning home field advantage. I would be concerned if i was a Giants/Jets fan facing the Steel City.

AND .....

U still owe me for that bet we made about the Steeler/Cowboys game. I'm a patient man, I can wait. :P
comments.subject: My balogne has a first name ..... It's STEELERS !!!! (It sounds better with the children rhyme tone)

comments.article:
Aaaarrrghhh! Why is JP Losman allowed to even touch the football these days? When Trent Edwards gets injured the Bills should just invite the QB of the University of Buffalo to guest star for them, I honestly think they'd do better. I would say that was one of the worst losses I've ever seen, except I'm a lifelong Bills fan, so the sad truth is I've seen much, much worse. In all of professional sports only Cubs fans have the right to even compare their endless sorrow and woe to ours.

Rooting for this year's incarnation of the team was a bit like pulling for the Starks in Ice & Fire. They started so strong but then the dung started to hit the fan, and when our young but fearless leader went down you knew it was all over. The only difference is there's no foreshadowing of a comeback for the Bills...

On my ladder of AFC East loathing I hate the Patriots just slightly more than the Jets, and the Dolphins significantly more than the Pats, so I guess I'm going for the Jets now to win the division. And then lose immediately in the first round :) Go Giants though
I can see how you're stressed. I've been a Jets fan all my life...and my wife for two and a half years is a hardcore Bills fan, being from Buffalo and all. You can imagine what it's like in my home.
I am a Giants fan for tonight, just to see Dallas lose and give the Eagles a chance to make the playoffs.

Just watched the highlight video on nfl.com. Amazing finish! (I must admit it was rather amusing to watch Favre hobble along on a 20+ yard bootleg in the first quarter. Can't blame the Bills defense for not expecting that call :-> )

that season ending game against Miami looms large on the schedule. The whole situation smells as if it's set up for a Hollywood ending, called "Chad's Revenge." And right now Pennington and the Fish are playing much better football than Brett and the Jets.

Imagine my surprise! Chad just broke a Marino record, with 17 completions in a row (over 2 games). And the Dolphins have the fewest turnovers through a team's first 14 games in NFL history. It would be ironic to have the Dolphins finally beat the Jets for a change, and with Chad Pennington on our side and Brett Favre on yours.

Yes, they got lucky against a poor team who gave them all they could handle. In boxing terms they have a heavyweight's chance. They can either be the good, the mediocre or the lazy Buster Douglas. Let's keep hoping the coaching improves. They still have the potential to be a dominant team if only Mangini would simplify the offense to their strengths.

The Cowboys Won...

WOOHOOO! \o/
Oh forgot to add. The play that made my day... Favre's channeling Sweetness. I just saw it again on Espn's highlights. So what if the Cowboys won. That play will keep me smiling all week.

Well, the 9ers have played the AFC East back to back to back so I've watched them all closely, and I'd have to say that the Dolphins look to be the best coached team. They really didn't make any mistakes, and they were opportunistic when they had to be. Buffalo is clearly on a downer, and the Jets seemed as if they expected to win without having to play the game. Favre v Pennington is a lot closer than you might think, but in all the games I watched, Shaun Hill was the best QB.
comments.subject: Jets v Miami

comments.article: I'm not sure what the majority of Jets fans would say about it, but I'm hoping we see "Chad's redemption" instead of "Chad's revenge". Same result for the Green & White but I don't think that Pennington was their problem. Parcells, who has more ties to coaching personnel across this league than any other active NFL figurehead, didn't mind snatching up the best available QB faster than ink dries. Do you think he was the source of NY's problems? Man-genius may think so but I say that NYJ w/ Pennington under center are still in playoff contention this year. Kris Jenkins is as responsible as anyone for their sucesses.

Actually, I liked Chad quite a bit. The Jets made a huge mistake in getting rid of him. Even after they picked up Brett, they should have held on to him... at least long enough to arrange a trade. That way at least they get a draft choice for him. Just cutting him and letting him get picked up by a division rival was insane.

I fear that Chad will still be winning games for the Fish for years after Brett has retired. And I have no confidence whatsoever in Kellen Clemens.
comments.subject: Pennington

comments.article:
Absolutely insane to just cut him, to be on the outside looking in anyway. It had all the appearance of a complete kneejerk reaction to let him go and avoid the QB controversy. I don't even think he was due anything major in roster bonuses or other guarantee money.

I hope for the Jets sake that Brett gives them another year, but I'm not looking forward to the offseason soap opera to see what will happen. I'm thinking QB of the future has to be on their mind in this draft, which is sad considering that Brett was so public about it not being his role to take Aaron Rodgers under his wing back in Green Bay.
comments.subject: Re: Pennington

comments.article:
Don't stress George. The Jets are playing the Seahawks today. Favre will throw for 300+ yards and their back will have a career day against the Cover-0.
I look for it to be about Jets 31, Seahawks 10.
comments.subject: Jets/Seahawks
